name: Sanctuary Camelback Mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My girlfriends and I celebrated a birthday with a spa retreat at the Sanctuary. Everything from the spa services to the food at Elements was incredible. One thing that sets this property apart is the amazing customer service. I have stayed at many 5 star resorts and have never encountered this sort of outgoing, "accomodate any request" attitude. We were impressed by the size, value and cleanliness of our room. The housekeeping was punctual and room service was equally timely.
reviews.title: Perfect girls spa getaway...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great resort for relaxation combined with exercise and yoga. We searched for a place to hep us jump start a new healthier lifestyle. This resort offers a variety of yoga, pilates and spinning classes, biking and hikes up Camelback (with a guide or on your own). All classes were led by well-trained, skilled and delightful people. It was just what we wanted. The resort itself is beautiful. We had a Mountain View Villa - lots of space, lovely and clean - the views just as promised. The photos on the website don't do it justice. The staff are among the best I've ever encountered - friendly and lots of attention to detail. The location is right at the base of Camelback mountain and away from the city but a short drive to great restaurants and Old Scottsdale. The location makes it a good spot for wildlife - many birds, esp. Roadrunners, my favorite! No loud music at the pool - another big plus for us! We hated to leave and plan to return.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This place was exactly what the website showed. The service from all of the staff was amazing at all times. One of the great things was the ability to pretty much walk anywhere you wanted. They provided maps in the room of running / walking routes around the facility. The gym, pool, and spa were amazingly clean and well maintained. And the location is close enough to any type of food you may want if your not dining at the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it and will be back ... hopefully soon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed there in the last 4 years. As long as you stay in one of the spa casitas, there's no place to stay except the Sanctuary if you aren't taking kids with you. I read a few of the other "poor" reviews, and they seem more targeted at the either the staff or at the price. As far as the staff comment goes, we've had nothing but 5 star service from the staff on both our trips - and especially at the pool. As far as price, I think the reviewer might not have enough experience with the higher end resorts because for the price the Sanctuary offers quite a bit of value relative to similarly priced resorts. However, there are difference in rooms and having viewed one of the mountain casitas, i can say that I do not think they are as nice or worthy of the same price as the spa casita. The restaurant was fabulous - we had a great dinner there, and the cocktails were great as well and worthy of the recent award.
reviews.title: If you aren't taking you kids, there's no place else to stay in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only complaint i have is to echo a similar one that another reviewer had - when you stay at a place that has local members and locals that use the spa frequently it can be a pain to get the appointments you want when you want them so you just have to plan ahead which can also be a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Quiet, elegant, peaceful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were married in May but with jobs and children a long honeymoon was out of the question. Looking on the internet I found this hotel and the pictures sold me on making reservations for three nights. We stayed in a mountain suite- which smelled very old upon opening the door. The furntiure and carpets were old and very dirty. The king sized bed was actually two singles somehow joined together. The bar was nice but overpriced as was the food in Elements. Service was slow, portions small and not very good.
reviews.title: Was expecting so much more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though we had booked three nights we left the next day and spent the rest of our honeymoon at home.
reviews.title: Very Nice, but Not Perfect
Nice but could have been better
reviews.text: After reading all of the TripAdvisor reviews, maybe my expectations for this hotel were too high. I think a 5 star rating is best reserved for truly memorable properties where location, service and amenities all come together.

reviews.title: Terrible experience
reviews.text: We booked during the summer to take advantage of the deeply discounted rates. As such, we were able to book a Mountain Casita right before the 4th of July holiday for ~ $200 per night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was quite nice, although you could tell it was an older, but nicely renovated space. Unfortunately, our room did not have a view of the mountain - only of the rooms across from us. The bathroom, with oversized tub was great and having the ability to get free dvd's from the front desk to watch on the flat screen tv was a nice touch.
reviews.title: A true sanctuary!!

likes.disliked: — King bed was two beds pushed together

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Went there for a couple of days just to relax and enjoy my 5th anniversary with my wife. We are a young couple (. Just turned 30 and she's 29) so we like more of the modern type hotels. The service is amazing, everybody does their best to make you feel good. Breakfast was probably one of the best I have had! Try the eggs Benedict!
reviews.title: Great escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is very relaxing and perfect temperature, everybody is really quiet and just enjoying their time there. No cell phones in the pool which I think is the way to go. Food at the pool was awesome as well, go for the turkey Focaccia sandwich.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was great, I was probably expecting something amazing, but it was still pretty good. Book your massages with time. Remember that everybody goes there with the same intentions so you can't really expect to get everything you want if you don't plan, I reserved abouta week before I got there. Yoga class was good, a little tough, but hada good time.
reviews.title: Perfect Staycation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wifi is free, which for me is a great plus, I hate t have to pay for wifi in the 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: Quiet and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was nice but nothing special. If I go back I'm definitely staying at the spa casitas. Still the room was good enough, awesome bed, not so good toilet, small shower and small tv, but its not the room why you go there.
reviews.title: The service was outstanding, never wanted to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not always do you find a first rate spa that is luxurious while also having friendly staff that seem to enjoy each other while providing great personal service to guests. We were greeted with an upgrade to a comfortable yet contemporary private suite - even though we had not stayed at the property before. At each turn we had relaxed staff saying good morning or whisking us a glass of ice water without asking. Spa services were good -- and we didn't have time to take advantage of the numerous fitness options including pilates, yoga and spinning while we enjoyed the pool and local sites. Very first class, yet casual in a private arizona-natural setting.
reviews.title: Quiet contemporary elegance with happy staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Beautiful view, rooms, pool, restaurant and staff. Amazing experience - a true sanctuary.
reviews.title: WOW - EXCELLENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without question our favorite travel destination is the Sanctuary Resort. My wife and I began traveling to different cities early in our now 19-year marriage. We would pick a city that the two of us had never visited together and select a 5 star resort in which to lodge during our stay. We have been to 52 destinations in the states and abroad; however, we keep coming back to the Sanctuary!
reviews.title: Heaven in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is professional and cordial. From the bell staff/valet (Lotto) to the spa personnel, every staff member makes you feel that their interaction with you is the most important interaction they will have that day. We have stayed at the resort over 20 times and have yet to have anything close to a negative experience. The rooms (which the Sanctuary calls "casitas") are wonderfully appointed and ALWAYS clean. On one occasion, the professional steam cleaning service contracted by the resort came to our casita, thinking it was empty, and I allowed them to service the unit. I watched in amazement as the technician cleaned all of the furniture, the floor coverings and the window treatments, while explaining that the resort does this at least twice a month for every casita. All this despite the fact that we had been in the room for two days and found it to be spotless!
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding is comfortable and we typically get our best nights rests during our stays at the Sanctuary. The food is awesome. Room service is prompt and the food is always delivered hot. The on-property restaurant, Elements, is spectacular. Chef Beau has a diverse menu with some of the finest items I have ever experienced.
reviews.title: Hot and beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reviewing an article in Via (AAA Magazine) about the deals in Arizona, my partner and I decided to book a room. We looked at several spas, but decided on Sanctuary due to it's relaxing atmosphere. We got a great deal, according to AAA rooms normally go for $600.00+ per night for our room, we got our room for around $100.00 a night. This is due to the heat, which we were expecting. The place is beautiful, well maintained, we never knew when house keeping would be around as they were so quiet. Special touches included arriving to the room at night with all the candles lite, water at our bed side and the room being sprayed with scents. The room was great, nice touches included flat screen TV, DVD player, CD player with white noise, paper every morning, excellent shampoo, soaps, etc....
reviews.title: Excellent Place - HOT MONTH

likes.disliked: — Location is in a residentual area, no restaurants or shopping within walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is an older place, but did not feel that way. They have done a great job keeping the place up. All the staff was wonderful, especially the front desk upon check in. Our plane arrived early and we were at the Spa at 1000 in the morning. We asked if they could recommend a place for us to wait (shopping area, or restaurant) until check in. The front desk checked for us and said we could check in right then if we wanted. It was great, we were able to relax and shower after our travel and start a day out in the City feeling refreshed.
reviews.title: A Sacred Place to Dwell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pool area is excellent, open 24/7. I have no complaints with this place.
reviews.title: Truly a Sanctuary from daily life...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My complaint is only with the Scottsdale Visitors Office. They sent us information speaking of a great Art Walk each Thursday night. This was one of the reasons we went there. We planned our stay around this Art Walk as this is a hobby of ours. They stated 100's of Art Galleries would be open with live music, wine, food, etc...well, Thursday night came and we made our way there...only to find about a dozen other tourist waundering around bumping into each other. Only about 6 Art Galleries were open. They stated that most all close entirely for the month of August due to heat. We felt very cheated by this. Also, the Visitors Office had NO GLBT information, we had to seek this out on our own, which truthfully was disappointing. We had heard the area had a huge GLBT community, but other than a few bars, and a few stores we found nothing.
reviews.title: Loved our peaceful suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our one-year anniversary at the Sanctuary and it was a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Fabulously Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sanctuary is blessed with its lovely Elements restaurant, with good food at good prices and a beautiful view. We had great weather which made the grounds easy to love, with birds singing in the mornings. The rooms are comfortable, with wonderful sheets, but our Mountain Casita bed needs replacement, consistent with another traveler's experience. Others have commented about the distance between their room and the center of the resort. We were happiest to be away from all the fray around the pool and casita-spa rooms, and the stairs between casitas made the farthest distances completely manageable (and very pleasant after dinner or in the early morning). The hotel is more expensive than it should be and the spa treatments are overpriced, although the spa is lovely and the tennis staff were so friendly and helpful. We had a nice stay, but not nice enough to leave us looking forward to a future visit.
reviews.title: Best in Scottsdale?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Sanctuary in May 2007. Although the grounds were beautiful, it wasn't exactly what we expected & we did not have the best experience. We decided to give it another try this year & we are so glad we did. This time around no complaints, it was exactly what we had hoped for to begin with.
reviews.title: Decided to give it a 2nd try, WONDERFUL!

likes.liked: — the grounds, pool, view of cameback mtn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was absolutely wonderful! From service, to our room, food, pool, & spa, it was all superb!! We decided to just stay in the Spa Casita Suite the whole visit this time around. The room had been updated w/ new furniture which was nice. Not sure if the mountain casita's were updated but they were in much need of a makeover.
reviews.title: Good (Not Great) Accomodation. Excellent Food

reviews.title: Heavenly solitude and relaxation for couples! Great escape. Very convenient location. Impeccable service.
In need of freshening up, but will return
reviews.text: We basically never left the campus. We had spa treatments every day. The spa was wonderful and the therapists were amazing. There is a daily resort fee that includes parking, the gym and internet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am already planning a return visit.
reviews.title: Stunning, inside and out! Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've had the privilege to stay at many fine resorts, and sometimes it is very hard to distinguish one from another. The Phoenix area is overloaded with top-end options like the Biltmore, Phoenician, Ritz, Four Seasons, Royal Palms (see my earlier review), etc., and like many of these, Sanctuary is part of the American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts which offers incredible perks and discounts. For sheer relaxation, peacefulness, solitude, and scenery in the desert, this is the top! The staff is very attentive and friendly in a casual yet very respectful manner (not formal or stuffy at all). Service is outstandingly prompt for any type of request. The turndown service each night was a very nice touch We stayed 6 nights and wished for 6 more. The contemporary styling of the rooms is very refreshing, and they are spacious and well furnished. And the views are amazing. We visited several of the top area resorts and are delighted we stayed here. The location is very convenient to the best Scottsdale has to offer. Check my other reviews for restaurant recommendations. Also, be sure to visit Julia Baker Chocolates at the Intercontinental for some of the best chocolates anywhere. The ultimate compliment is that we can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Amazing resort in the desert, with one exception

aka: Sanctuary Camelback Mountain Hotel Paradise Valley
description: Discover your sanctuary at the best Arizona resort...a luxury boutique hideaway on Camelback Mountain. Overlooking the spectacular views of Paradise Valley, relax in a mountainside or spa casita. Retreat to Sanctuary Spa for Asian-inspired treatments and exhilarating classes. Taste the award-winning cuisine of elements' by Food Network star Chef Beau MacMillan. Savor the sunset at jade bar or on edge, raising the bar for happy hour. Play tennis or hike in a fabulous setting, lounge by the infinity-edge pool, or indulge in Scottsdale's hottest shopping, cultural attractions and championship golf just minutes away.
